column1: Usman (Russian: У́смань) is a town and the administrative center of Usmansky District in Lipetsk Oblast
column5: the administrative center of the oblast. Population: 18

column2: it was first an ostrog (fortress) on the Belgorod Line and named after the Usman River. In 1652
column3: it was raided by the Tatars. It was granted town status in 1779.

column1: Within the framework of administrative divisions
column2: Usman serves as the administrative center of Usmansky District. As an administrative division
column3: it is incorporated within Usmansky District as Usman Town Under District Jurisdiction. As a municipal division
column4: Usman Town Under District Jurisdiction is incorporated within Usmansky Municipal District as Usman Urban Settlement.

column1: The minor planet 16515 Usman'grad was named after the town.

column2: co-recipient of the 1964 Nobel Prize in Physics
